name: 'Institutional Memory' Online Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Did Toby apply for a pardon?
questions.explanation:
No.

	When CJ found out that Toby hadn't applied for a pardon, she thought it was so the President didn't have to make the choice whether or not to choose him.

questions.text: When the President-Elect offered CJ a position in his administration due to her institutional memory, how long did he say he would need her?
questions.explanation:
Two years.

	CJ told Danny she thought she would have to take the President-Elect's offer just because he was the President and he asked her to hold the position of special counsel.

questions.text: When CJ went to visit Toby, he told her that he had found a typographical error in what major political paper?
options: Oath of Office for the President of the United States
questions.explanation:
Constitution.

	If Toby was right about the error, he said it could turn the meaning of the takings clause in the Constitution into something completely different. After finding the error, Toby said he checked several different websites for the error and called the National Archive to find out if the error was in the original.

questions.text: What member of Danny's family, who was visiting, did he want CJ to meet?
questions.explanation:
Sister.

	CJ had told Danny she would have dinner with him before she checked her book so she couldn't have dinner with him or meet his sister due to work. Danny said her schedule made her elusive and he liked that.

questions.text: Did Kate get offered a job in the Santos administration?
questions.explanation:
No.

	CJ told Kate it would be only a matter of time before the Santos administration offered her a job, but later she told Will that someone else was offered the NSA position.

questions.text: When Kate and Will first saw Frank Hollis in the Roosevelt room, what state did Margaret tell them he owned?
questions.explanation:
Montana.

	CJ corrected Margaret by telling her that Frank Hollis didn't own all of Montana, but just a part of it. Kate wanted her to ask for a piece of the state.

questions.text: What did Will say was the real reason for the "Times" reporter for the business desk to leave his job?
questions.explanation:
Tax Fraud.

	Will mentioned Lisa Benoit had taken over for the previous "Times" reporter who ran the business desk because Lisa had mentioned to Will that she thought the budget report had an error in it regarding gas being fifty-cents to the gallon. CJ told him it wasn't an error. The President wanted gas to be fifty-cents to a gallon.

questions.text: Kate suggested Will run for Congressman of Oregon.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Kate was convincing Will that he could find someone to run for Congress and teach them before the election and then she realized that Will would be perfect for the job. He didn't want to do it, but Kate convinced him he could run and win.

questions.text: Who came to CJ about a pardon for Toby?
questions.explanation:
Andy.

	Andy wanted CJ to talk to the President about it, but CJ went to Toby first and asked him if wanted a pardon. Toby told her he didn't want a pardon, but thanked her for asking him. He told her he had to leave on the twenty-sixth of January for the prison at Petersburg which was low security and had ten bunks to a room.

questions.text: Which position did CJ tell Danny (by a nod of the head) that she wanted to take?
options: Board of Director position at Franklin Institute
questions.explanation:
Frank Hollis' job offer.

	After visiting Toby, CJ went to Danny's apartment and they talked. Danny asked her if she wanted to take the President-Elect's offer and CJ shook her head no which left her with the position that Frank Hollis gave her which was to take ten billion dollars and construct highways in Africa.
